comments.author: rokejulianlockhart
comments.body:
Is this issue for addition of support for Set-Timezone via Linux and/or macOS?
If so, implementation of this would potentially require interaction with different subsystems because 'timedatectl' is part of 'systemd', so systems without 'systemd' would not be able to utilise the command. Consequently, is systemd a prerequisite of PowerShell via Linux? Despite all of what I stated, I am supportive of this proposition.

comments.body: @iSazonov, are you certain that 'http://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/3605' removed this? 'http://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/1109' as the culprit appears to be more probable.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> is systemd a prerequisite of PowerShell via Linux?

No, PowerShell has no specific prerequisites (but .Net Runtime and MMI have).

PowerShell follow .Net to reduce complicity and increase reliability. If .Net hasn't API to set timezone PowerShell can not set timezone too. Sometimes PowerShell uses OS specific p/invokes but only if they is a standard like POSIX, otherwise it would be very difficult to implement, test and support.
